main event: On December 1, 1957, a brightly burning object was observed falling in the vicinity of Hamburg, Germany.
interesting points: The object struck the earth at an angle of approximately 30 degrees above the horizon.,Analysis revealed magnesium and aluminum oxides in the residue at the impact site.,No metallic pieces were recovered, only combustion products were found.,Extensive digging operations were conducted at the site by German Army Engineers.,The incident was ultimately considered closed by local authorities.
witness description: Professor Doctor from the University of Hamburg
